text: if President Barack Obama thought the
controversy over whether to build a
Muslim cultural center and mosque near
Ground Zero would simply go away during
his 10-day family vacation to Martha's
Vineyard he was clearly mistaken on
Sunday in downtown Manhattan hundreds of
protesters opposed to the building of
the muslim center rallied against the
project arguing the proposed location
just two blocks from the site of the
terror attacks on 911 is insensitive
America needs to man up right about now
we're bowing to Muslims met want to kill
us and hate us I don't believe that
every Muslim is a terrorist but I do
know that every terrorist that was on
the plains that killed my brother wasn't
lost and I just don't feel that it's
morally right and ethically right to put
a mosque here where my brother was
killed around the corner kept apart by
police and barricades supporters of the
muslim center held their own rally
citing the right to religious freedom
and a need to promote tolerance there
really is nothing to worry about the
kind of muslims that will be going to
this mosque and basically it's just two
floors the rest of it is all community
center are very much not the kind of
muslim is that they need to worry about
those are very different and we're very
ordinary Americans we want to stand for
the right of individuals to practice the
religion
where they change and we want to stand
against what is going to be coming up a
a climate of fear hatred in Islam OBO
with the 911 anniversary less than three
weeks away it's unlikely this
controversy will go away anytime soon
President Obama has said he supports the
right of Muslims to build the center
near Ground Zero but has refrained from
saying whether it's wise to do so John
Decker Reuters
